title: THINGS YOU CAN DO BEFORE YOU START YOUR HOMESTEAD | Start Homesteading Where You Are!

subtasks: Read about various aspects of homesteading like gardening, farming animals, and animal husbandry.
Learn about purchasing and maintaining land, wells, septic tanks, and farm buildings.
Identify desired animals and their requirements.

tasks.task: Start Homesteading Now (Even if in a constrained space)**
subtasks: Garden in available small spaces (backyard, balconies).
Raise small livestock like chickens, rabbits, or quails in urban settings.
Adapt pets to noisy or small spaces (e.g., goats vs. rabbits).
Learn and apply indoor homesteading skills (canning, fermentation, making butter, soap, etc.).
Plan savings for future homestead purchases (land, animals, tools).
Budget for setup costs like fencing, tools, and livestock.
Connect with experienced homesteaders in your area.
Volunteer to help on their homestead to learn practical skills.
Learn about regional farming and homesteading specificities from local experts.
Determine preferred location based on climate, soil, and community.
Familiarize yourself with local farms and communities.
Consider long-term commitment to the site once gardens and animals are established.
